intro: Mabea occidentalis var. laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf mabea, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its smooth, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in moist, sandy soils in woodland and scrub habitats.
